result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Keith Aubol

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Defendant Michael Keith Aubol in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Michael Keith Aubol.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:07 PM Defendant Michael Keith Aubol appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Michael Keith Aubol.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF352 and 22CT130. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint in both files, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s) and in the 22CT130 file, and requests a preliminary hearing in the felony file. Court quashes warrants in both files, questions nonappearance. Attorney Reid notes that he was sick with COVID. State notes that there are no FTAs or prior criminal history aside from the ones he is appearing in today. State asks for $250 in 22CF352. No contact with Menards.  $100 in 22CT130, No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. Attorney Reid asks for signature bonds or $50 in each file. Notes that he voluntarily turned himself in, is currently on SSI, and has family in the area. No criminal history or history of FTAs. State notes that defendant did not turn himself in but was arrested during a traffic stop. 
Court orders $300 in 22CF352. No contact with Menards Stores. $100 cash in 22CT130. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:14 PM Defendant Michael Keith Aubol not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. State notes mandatory citation for today and filed a new Felony charge. State requests warrant in 22CT130 and 22CF352. Court orders warrant based on nonappearance in 22CT130 and 22CF352. Douglas and adjoining including Ashland in CT and in CF case WI and MN.
